F1.name: (meta)data are assigned a globally unique and persistent identifier.

F1-01MD.name: Metadata and data is assigned a globally unique identifier.

F1-01MD-1.name: Identifier may conform to a UUID or HASH-type syntax.
F1-01MD-1.description_for_passed: Identifier conforms to a UUID or HASH-type syntax.
F1-01MD-1.description_for_failure: Identifier did not conform to a UUID or HASH-type syntax.

recommendation.value: The identifier may conform to a UUID or HASH syntax, although a globally unique identifier (GUID) is preferable. A GUID is unique, irrespective of the context.

F1-01MD-1.recommendation_details: These identifiers are not, however, guaranteed to be globally unique: some other resource might have the same identifier. For a higher degree of FAIRness, consider defining an identifier that is guaranteed to globally uniquely identify a particular resource irrespective of the context, i.e., no distinct object has the same identifier.
F1-01MD-1.losses: Without a unique identifier of any kind, there is no guarantee that resources with the same identifier provisioned by different sources represent the same subject.

F1-01MD-2.name: Identifier should conform to a defined unique identifier syntax.
F1-01MD-2.description_for_passed: Identifier conformed to a defined unique identifier syntax (IRI, URL).
F1-01MD-2.description_for_failure: Identifier did not conform to a defined unique identifier syntax (IRI, URL).

recommendation.value: Define a globally unique identifier (GUID) for the resources, i.e., an identifier that is unique irrespective of context.

F1-01MD-2.recommendation_details: Define identifiers guaranteed to globally uniquely identify a particular resource irrespective of the context, i.e., no distinct object has the same identifier. Examples of GUIDs include URL, PURL, DOI, ARK, and Handle System ID. The use of a GUID results in an Advanced maturity level. As an alternative, you can use a UUID or hash; however, they do not ensure uniqueness irrespective of context, which results in an Initial maturity level.
F1-01MD-2.losses: Without a globally unique identifier, there is no guarantee that resources with the same identifier provisioned by different sources represent the same subject.
